        <title><![CDATA[In home caregiver - Client: 61 Woman with MS]]></title>
        <description><![CDATA[
  
 Title: Care Consultant for a very wonderful client 
  

  
 Pay: $20.00/hr - $24.00/hr [DOE] 
  

  
 Schedule/Work hours: Minimum 1 day - 4 hrs a week 
  

  
 Location: Santa Rosa , CA 
  

  
 AVIE Partners are advocates for wellness, not just for your loved one, but for the entire family. Each partner has experience in providing care and has a personal interest within the home-care space. All of our partners are carefully vetted to bring empathy, compassion, and expertise into their work. They deepen support capacity and help alleviate the pressure families face when trying to navigate big decisions on their own. 
  

  
 The ideal candidate must be able to care for our clients and their property with dignity, patience, compassion, and respect. This person will encourage and remain empathetic to the clients at all times. 
  

  
 Responsibilities:  
  

  

  
+  Patient, calm, friendly, curious, encouraging, engaging, competent, sense of humor, active due to sensation of defensiveness if provoked 
  

  
+  Someone who respects client’s space and privacy, but is also an enjoyable companion and skillful at encouraging the client to be more active and engaged (go for walks, light housekeeping, meal prep, organization, home projects, nutrition advocate, help the client discover new activities that bring the client joy and fulfillment) 
  

  
+  Someone who has experience working with people who have MS or mentally cycle,  — i.e. Know how to deal with pain managment, practice patience, etc. 
  

  
+   Home assistance  – Provide light housekeeping, run errands or provide transportation if needed.  Accompany clients to appointments and assist with medications. Prepare meals, purchase food and provide personal assistance with general living needs.  Personal services could include toileting, bathing, feeding and grooming. Provide any financial aid if needed such as balancing checkbooks, going to the bank or helping the client to pay their bills. 
  

  
+   Companionship  – Provide companionship and conversation by stimulating, encouraging and assisting an individual.   
  

  

  
 Requirements:  
  

  

  
+  High school diploma preferred. 
  

  
+  Must be able to complete a Criminal Background report. Must have Active License 
  

  
+  Ability to lift up to 25 pounds at a time 
  

  
+  Ability to reach, bend, kneel and stand for (sometimes) a long period of time 
  

  

  
 The ideal person for this position has experience, enjoys working individually or on occasion as a team, is well-spoken, energetic, and personable.   
  

  
 Requirements:  
  

  

  
+  High school diploma or GED preferred 
  

  
+  Detail-oriented, confidential, and professional 
  

  
+  Ability to read, write and speak English 
  

  
+  Must be able to lift and carry up to 25 pounds at times 
  

  
+  Must be able to stand for long periods of time and reach, bend, lift and pull 
  

  

  
 About AVIE Care 
  

  
 AVIE was created with the growing awareness of the desires of older adults to remain independent, empowered, and thriving in the comfort of their own homes. 
  

  
 Accordingly, adult children and other family members increasingly face the weight of responsibility for the coordination and assistance of their parents’ needs to help them achieve this desired quality of life, often times from a distance and while raising families of their own. 
  

  
 Through trusted partnership, our mission is to help older adults and their families thrive together by having the assistance they need to ensure: 
  

  

  
+  Their loved one is supported in fulfilling their optimal quality of life physically, socially, emotionally, and spiritually 
  

  
+  The involved family members remain fully engaged within the circle of support through transparent and ongoing communication 
  

  
  "Our vision and intention at AVIE is for older adults and their families to experience the later phases of life as abundant, generative, loving, and meaningful."  
  
 https://www.aviecare.com/

        <title><![CDATA[Care Manager - Care Operations]]></title>
        <description><![CDATA[
  
 Job Title: Avie Partner - Care Manager  
  

  
 Location : Sonoma/Napa Counties or Remote 
  

  
 Job Status: Part-time (Full-time potential)  Starting Hourly: $21-26 
  

  
 
  

  
 Avie Care is looking for a dedicated Avie Partner to join our Client Management team!  Avie Partners support older adults and their families: managing outcomes, satisfaction, and maximizing client experience in our services for older adults who need on-demand or in-person support. If you are empathetic, self-motivated, and interested in a human-centered company, please feel free to reach out via hello@aviecare.com. 
  

  
 
  

  
 Responsibilities 
  

  

  
+  Build relationships and act as the primary contact point for clients and their families 
  

  
+  Develop client’s scheduling requests to optimize their support 
  

  
+  Actively listen and communicate the client’s issues and feedback to the right service providers, family members, and other appropriate members of their care team 
  

  
+  Work with the AVIE team to schedule the client’s optimal preferences for care coordination 
  

  
+  Manage full program implementation for clients; including communicating, training, feedback gathering, and measuring results 
  

  
+  Utilize reporting and dashboards for Client Operations to holistically understand client behavior and monitor the program's effectiveness 
  

  
+  Work closely with business, marketing, and client ops to ensure the program is fully optimized.  
  

  

  
 
  

  
 Day to Day  
  

  
 Manage client check-ins, schedules, and caregiver recruiting. We anticipate this job to be 20-30 hours per week with the potential to grow full time. You will work across departments to help with client satisfaction, product, marketing, etc. for program development and improvement.  
  
 Experience 
  

  
+  2+ years of experience in case management, or client management within a health care environment  
  

  
+  Experience developing and improving mission-critical business processes that scale 
  

  
+  Ability to work cross-functionally, with diverse skill sets, to drive outcomes 
  

  
+  Ability to take an analytical approach to solve problems in a fast-paced environment 
  

  
+  Bachelor’s degree or Masters in Social Work, Psychology, Gerontology, or related field preferred and/or equivalent experience as a care or case manager, i.e social worker or counselor working with seniors.  
  

  

  
 
  

  
 About Us 
  

  
 We are a small early-stage start-up group filled with passion and drive. We encourage self-expression, creativity, and a culture that is positive, supportive, and inclusive. You’ll be working with well-respected experts in the industry who are building a new concept to care that goes beyond the traditional healthcare paradigm. The older adult market is growing and we are creating a service that is unlike any other, check us out: https://aviecare.com/
